item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded:
Although, it may not be all that important to even use that anymore. Assuming that the #1 player yesterday used Obsessive Insight on every mission, he'd still have gotten more than the next two players. So if anyone can do what he did, just without the jutsu, he/she may be able to hit the top three anway.

Of course, it's going to be hard to predict what people will do differently now that the top three players can be promoted to Sannin.

I'm not seeing why there should be waves. The first wave is obvious, and will probably last for about two weeks (at least thats my guess, it'll definitely be worth watching to see), but I don't see why there should be any more waves.

Also, a quick question that I've been wondering, when it says you have to be today's number one player (now top three), does it actually mean yesterday's number one player (/top three), just displayed on the day that you take the mission? Or do you have to take the mission on the day you try to hit the number one (/top three) spot in a sort of leap of faith that you'll actually succeed in becoming number one (/top three)?

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded: Being able to use obsessive insight assumes you can pass A-Ranks with just Emo3 (the other two parties members are Timmy2 and Panda).

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded: So you can use Obsessive Insight for free, instead of having to charge chakra every four or five missions.

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded:
I'm aware of all those as well. I suppose that I don't know exactly how many people would use such techniques to hang out with anonymous for the sole purpose of hitting top 3 (or #1 if they want the theme for that), but it seems unlikely to me that both of the people hanging out with Anonymous are doing it to hit top 3, as well as multiple people using other tricks.

Forgive me if I'm missing something obvious, but why is it so important to hang out with Anonymous in order to hit top 3 (or #1 previously)?

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded: That's what I foresee: a sudden rush towards Sannin, then a significant drop off. Sannin activity will probably be done in waves now: a lot of people try, then not many, then a lot, then not many, &c.

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded:
@ Fax- I'm aware of all those as well. I suppose that I don't know exactly how many people would use such techniques to hang out with anonymous for the sole purpose of hitting top 3 (or #1 if they want the theme for that), but it seems unlikely to me that both of the people hanging out with Anonymous are doing it to hit top 3, as well as multiple people using other tricks.

Also, as Uzuki said, the other ones come at a cost. It might not even be worth it. Though you could partially side-step the ryo penalty by purchasing a bunch of items, and then selling them the next day. You'd lose half your ryo, but that's better than all of it.

Basically what I meant to say is that, while before hanging out with Anonymous was practically a necessity, now it can be reasonably done without him.

—-

Also, the fact that more people will be able to achieve Sannin rank means that more people will be taken out of the Jonin pool. Since Sannin don't count in terms of the top players, and even if they did, they have little incentive to hit top 3 (aside from the theme you get for being #1), then after a while, there may be less competition to get top 3.

Or perhaps not… but logically, it makes sense.

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded: The 100 stamina is more than made up by 3 hairpin pieces, and the 100k XP can be more than made up by free use of the +50% XP jutsu.

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded: Floating on Air and Make-Out Mood's would both be a high cost to pay to hang out with Anon on your top 3 day. Floating would set your ryo to zero (limiting parties). Make-Out Mood costs either 100k XP or 100 stamina.

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded: Actually, the Hanging Out bit is incorrect. You get the top two friends-point people, plus anyone with the Mysterious Power bloodline, and then you can do it with Floating on Air or a Make-Out Mood Enhancer too.

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded:
Well, now you only need to be top 3 to get Sannin, which makes it a HELL of a lot easier. Yesterday's top player was at around 1.76 million XP (which means 1.9 million XP from the party house should just about solidify your status as top player), but the third was only at a little more than 1 million XP. Also, considering that only 2 players can hang out with Anonymous in one day (exclusing the mysterious power), there's almost guaranteed to be at least one player achieving top 3 WITHOUT hanging out with Anonymous.

Given, the competition will probably rise to the new challenge (more people will set their sites on it), but if things remain how they are, getting top 3 should be fairly easy with the right planning.

item.title: Re: Becoming #1 player
item.content:encoded: You get a bunch of daily XP. It's the same for both season 2 and season 1. The 'best' way to do it is to get a ton of stamina on one day and hang out with anonymous. Do as many A-Rank missions as you can while using the jutsu that gives +50% XP, and stack that with as many other +XP bonuses as you can find.
